body:
Opps.

There's not actually many uses for subclients. The only obvious choices are text editor and terminal, and the text editor should be fairly easy to do. I have some ideas for how to implement the editor, and have a front-end written for a similar project that can be used.

The idea is that you would do something like `%edit script.py` in the Notebook and the editor app would open in a new tab with `script.py` ready to edit. If you wanted to open a different file, you'd use the Notebook to open another instance of the editor in another tab. Each instance of the editor only handles one file.

The name of the file is shown in the tab, using `<title>`, and the state of the file, saved or modified, is indicated by the favicon. I used a little floppy disk icon and changed the colours to make two, one red and one green, so when you edit the file, the favicon turns red, and when you save it, it turns green.

There's nothing inside the actual viewport apart from the editor, margin:0. All the info is on the browser tab, so you can just use the browser's native tabs for switching between files. _The full path for the file is in the URL bar when you open that tab._

This all works nicely in practice, I think at least, and it means that the server only needs to (safely) expose a write to disk call. An editor only needs to be able to save. Everything else is client-side.

I should note that we already have a text editor for in the design phase.
 We have been designing the URL scheme to allow these other things to be
added.  But I think the editor and terminal should be their own IPEPs.

I agree they should be broken up into two IPEPs, then close this one.

I didn't know you'd made a start on the editor. I assume you're using ACE. Are you aiming for a full, text editor app? The one-file-per-tab approach creates a much nicer UX than you'd immediately assume.

I've got some screenshots some place ~ I made the editor ages ago ~ but you get the idea, and have some of your own anyway.

We haven't made the final decision about ACE versus CodeMirror, but I
imagine there will be pretty loud support for ACE.  It would be a full page
editor application opened on its own browser tab so the URL matches the
file location similar to GitHub.  This URL mapping is the part we have
worked out.  Once we have some of the groundwork done, it shouldn't be too
difficult to implement this.  Do you want to create these two new separate
IPEPs for the text editor and html terminal?
